intro: Coussapoa froesii, commonly known as the Brazilian bellflower, is a striking flowering plant native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with opposite, lanceolate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to habitat loss, Coussapoa froesii is considered endangered and is of significant interest in botanical conservation efforts.
